Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2013 10:45PM englishteacher wrote: Can someone help decipher this report please??!! Today BS said I need another lumpectomy. Report says invasive carcinoma less than .5 mm from anterior/superficial margin. Diagnosis invasive ductal carcinoma in situ. Total Nottingham score 5. Grade 1, low combined histolic grade, favorable. Tumor size 1 cm. Total sentinel lymph node involved by metastatic carcinoma zero. Positive for estrogen and progesterone receptors allred score 7-8. Her2 negative. Ki-67 low proliferation 5% positive. Need 2nd lumpectomy. Why?

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2013 12:28AM englishteacher wrote: Hello everyone. Diagnosed Valentine's day. Lumpectomy and lymph node 4 days ago. Don't know anything yet except "no cancer in the lymph node" and starting radiation in 3 weeks. Going back to work Tuesday. Pain in armpit worse than I thought. Single mom. Two daughters and I still in some shock. Just reaching out. Feels surreal. Like when I look at the scars I think "when did THAT happen?" Any feedback appreciated.
